subject: Medicine
title: Mirror Neurons and Empathy
description: A quick, practical guide to Mirror Neurons and Empathy.

hook.text: When you watch someone get a paper cut, your brain fires as if YOU got cut. Mirror neurons make you flinch.

buildup.text: Mirror neurons fire both when you perform an action and when you watch someone else perform it.

discovery.text: They may be the neural basis for empathyâ€”allowing you to understand others by simulating their experience.

twist.text: Some researchers debate whether mirror neurons truly exist in humans or if the effect is more complex.

climax.text: Whether through mirror neurons or broader networks, the brain evolved to understand other minds.

punchline.text: Your brain rehearses what others experience.

quiz.question: What do mirror neurons do?
options: Fire both when you act and when you watch someone else act
Only activate during sleep to process emotions
Block empathy to protect against emotional overload
